chinese: [C, usu. pl.] a person who was born in the 1980s, 1990s, or early 2000s 千禧一代
examples: e.g. [[Millennials]] have grown up with the Internet and can't imagine a world without it.

chinese: talk or think about pleasant events in your past 谈论， 追忆（快乐的往事）
examples: e.g. We sat side by side, [[reminiscing]] about the past.

chinese: feeling sad because you do not want to do what you are doing 遗憾地；惋惜地
examples: e.g. I must [[regretfully]] decline your invitation.

chinese: say sth., esp. about sth. you have just noticed 评论，谈到，说起（尤指刚察觉的事）
examples: e.g. Anderson left the table, [[remarking]] that he had some work to do.；e.g. He made a number of rude [[remarks]] about the food.

chinese: sth. that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed 言论；意见；评论
examples: e.g. Anderson left the table, [[remarking]] that he had some work to do.；e.g. He made a number of rude [[remarks]] about the food.

chinese: 1) a fact or an event in nature or society, esp. one that is not fully understood 现象
examples: e.g. Language is a social and cultural [[phenomenon]].；e.g. The rock band was a [[phenomenon]] — nobody had heard anything like them before.

chinese: 2) sb. / sth. that is very unusual because of a rare quality or ability that they have 非凡的人（事物）；奇才；奇事
examples: e.g. Language is a social and cultural [[phenomenon]].；e.g. The rock band was a [[phenomenon]] — nobody had heard anything like them before.

chinese: 1) a very large number of things produced at the same time 大量涌现；迸发
examples: e.g. Technology is offering us an [[outpouring]] of opportunities that will help us stay curious and creative.；e.g. The news of his death produced an instant [[outpouring]] of grief.

chinese: 2) an uncontrolled expression of strong feelings （强烈感情的）流露，倾吐
examples: e.g. Technology is offering us an [[outpouring]] of opportunities that will help us stay curious and creative.；e.g. The news of his death produced an instant [[outpouring]] of grief.

chinese: happening or done in a natural, often sudden way, without any planning or without being forced 自发的；自然而生的；一时冲动的
examples: e.g. The audience broke into [[spontaneous]] applause.

chinese: [U] a feeling of great surprise 吃惊；惊奇
examples: e.g. Much to the [[amazement]] of her family, she left school to pursue her acting career.

chinese: [C, U] a condition of life that causes difficulty or suffering 艰苦；贫困
examples: e.g. People suffered many [[hardships]] during that long winter.

chinese: [C, usu. sing.] a reduction in economic, business, or other activity （经济、商业等活动的）下降，衰退
examples: e.g. There is evidence of a [[downturn]] in the housing market.

chinese: (abbr. p.a.) (fml.) for each year 每年
examples: e.g. The country exports goods worth $600 million [[per annum]].

chinese: (only before noun) only 唯一的
examples: e.g. The story was published with the [[sole]] purpose of selling newspapers.

chinese: 1) sb.'s ability to do sth. 能力；才能
examples: e.g. They are worried about their [[capacity]] to invest for the future.；e.g. The newly-built theater has a seating [[capacity]] of 2,000.

chinese: 2) the amount of space a container, room, etc. has to hold things or people 容量；容积；容纳人数
examples: e.g. They are worried about their [[capacity]] to invest for the future.；e.g. The newly-built theater has a seating [[capacity]] of 2,000.

chinese: [C] a child or young person 孩童；年轻人
examples: e.g. These courses are specially designed for [[youngsters]] aged seven to nine.

chinese: having a lot of experience of life, and good judgment about socially important things such as art and fashion. 见多识广的；老练的；练达的
examples: e.g. Mark is a smart and [[sophisticated]] young man.

chinese: [C] the way in which a person or a group of people lives and works 生活方式
examples: e.g. Many people are trying to adopt a healthy [[lifestyle]] these days.

chinese: 1) different from other people or things; doing things in your own way 特立独行的；独特的
examples: e.g. His music is highly [[individualistic]] and may not appeal to everyone.；e.g. A more [[individualistic]] society is also one with much more loneliness.

chinese: 2) believing that what individual people want is more important than what society or the government wants 个人主义的
examples: e.g. His music is highly [[individualistic]] and may not appeal to everyone.；e.g. A more [[individualistic]] society is also one with much more loneliness.

chinese: having the qualities that are needed to succeed as an entrepreneur 具有创业素质的
examples: e.g. The successful candidate will be an [[entrepreneurial]], goal-oriented problem solver.

chinese: 1) sure that you have the ability to do things well or deal with situations successfully 有信心的；自信的
examples: e.g. I feel much more [[confident]] about myself and my abilities these days.；e.g. We are [[confident]] that next year's profits will be higher.

chinese: 2) (not before noun) sure that sth. will happen in the way that you want or expect 确信的；有把握的
examples: e.g. I feel much more [[confident]] about myself and my abilities these days.；e.g. We are [[confident]] that next year's profits will be higher.

chinese: fairly large, esp. large enough to have an effect or be important 相当大的（尤指能产生影响或很重要）
examples: e.g. [[Considerable]] progress has been made in finding a cure for the disease.

chinese: frightening in a way that makes you feel less confident 使人气馁的；吓人的
examples: e.g. They were faced with the [[daunting]] task of restoring the house.

chinese: 1) understand or deal with sth. difficult 理解，应付（困难复杂的情况）
examples: e.g. This outlook helped her [[navigate]] through her later years with success.；e.g. There weren't any road signs to help us [[navigate]] through the maze of one-way streets.

chinese: 2) find which way you need to go while traveling from one place to another （为···）导航，指引方向
examples: e.g. This outlook helped her [[navigate]] through her later years with success.；e.g. There weren't any road signs to help us [[navigate]] through the maze of one-way streets.

chinese: 1) believe or say that sb. / sth. has a particular quality 认为···具有···的特征
examples: e.g. People were beginning to [[attribute]] superhuman qualities to him.；e.g. The fall in the number of deaths from heart disease is generally [[attributed]] to improvements in diet.

chinese: 2) believe or say that a situation or event is caused by sth. 把···归因于···
examples: e.g. People were beginning to [[attribute]] superhuman qualities to him.；e.g. The fall in the number of deaths from heart disease is generally [[attributed]] to improvements in diet.

chinese: (infml.) knowing a lot about sth. and able to make good judgments about it 有见识的；在行的
examples: e.g. She bought the laptop on the advice of a computer-[[savvy]] friend.；e.g. He's obviously got a lot of political [[savvy]].

chinese: [U] (infml.) practical knowledge and ability 实际知识和能力；见识
examples: e.g. She bought the laptop on the advice of a computer-[[savvy]] friend.；e.g. He's obviously got a lot of political [[savvy]].

chinese: supporting new or modern ideas and methods, esp. in politics and education （尤指在政治和教育方面） 进步的，先进的
examples: e.g. We're looking for [[progressive]] ideas to move the company forward.

chinese: (fml.) think of sth. in a particular way or as having a particular quality 认为；视为
examples: e.g. These buildings are [[deemed]] to be of architectural importance and must be protected.

chinese: (BrE self-centred) tending to think only about yourself and not thinking about the needs or feelings of other people 自我中心的；自私的
examples: e.g. She sounds totally [[self-centered]] and is showing you no consideration.

chinese: feeling that you have the right to do or have what you want without having to work for it or deserve it, just because of who you are （由于自身身份）认为应得的，有权利的，有资格的
examples: e.g. I don't want to make my kids feel [[entitled]] only because I am a teacher at this school.

chinese: 1) the act of buying and using products 购买；消费
examples: e.g. These products are not for national [[consumption]], but for export.；e.g. The government is determined to reduce the UK's total energy [[consumption]].

chinese: 2) the amount of energy, oil, electricity, etc. that is used （能源、油、电等的）消耗量
examples: e.g. These products are not for national [[consumption]], but for export.；e.g. The government is determined to reduce the UK's total energy [[consumption]].

chinese: (forecast, forecast; forecasted, forecasted) say what you expect to happen in the future 预测；预报
examples: e.g. They [[forecast]] a large drop in unemployment over the next two years.；e.g. The weather [[forecast]] said it was going to rain.

chinese: [C] a statement of what is expected to happen in the future, esp. in relation to a particular event or situation 预测；预报
examples: e.g. They [[forecast]] a large drop in unemployment over the next two years.；e.g. The weather [[forecast]] said it was going to rain.

chinese: [C, usu. pl., U] a strong desire to have or achieve sth. 强烈愿望；志向；抱负
examples: e.g. When I was 12, I had [[aspirations]] to play professional basketball.

chinese: (fml.) in addition to what has already been said 此外；而且；不仅如此；更有甚者
examples: e.g. She always arrives on time; [[furthermore]], her work is always excellent.

chinese: [U] (electronic commerce) the business of buying and selling of goods and services on the Internet 电子商务
examples: e.g. Travel companies have moved from the traditional bricks-and-mortar (实体的) environment to [[e-commerce]].

chinese: influenced by the most fashionable styles and ideas 时髦的；受新潮思想影响的
examples: e.g. He writes for some [[trendy]] magazine.

chinese: [C] a fashion, game, type of music, etc. that becomes very popular for a short time 时尚；一时的狂热
examples: e.g. If history is any guide, this latest diet for losing weight is just another [[craze]].

chinese: apart from 除了···以外
examples: e.g. Are you studying any science subjects other than chemistry?

chinese: used when you are comparing two things or people and saying that the second one is very different from the first 和···形成对照；相比之下
examples: e.g. The company lost $13 million this year, in contrast to a profit of $15 million last year.

chinese: used for talking about the ways in which two things are different, or about the ways in which sth. has changed 相比于
examples: e.g. Unemployment in the region currently stands at 10.1 percent, as compared to a national average of 7.7 percent.

chinese: (figuratively) resonate with; feel emotionally relevant to 与···产生共鸣；与···产生情感联结
examples: e.g. If this story [[spoke to]] you, I very much want to hear from you.

chinese: 墨尔本 (澳大利亚城市，位于维多利亚州)
